sub_title: EMEA Business Coordinator at Cargill Cocoa & Chocolate
summary:
I am a results-oriented, disciplined, highly motivated, and an internationally experienced business administration professional with a passion for operations and supply chain strategies; aiming to make organizations more efficient in achieving its business goals.
With over 13 years of invaluable and varied working experience from small firms to global conglomerates I have utilized analytical skills to optimize operational processes and identifying trends and opportunities in highly complex environments. Moreover, having taken additional culture-and sociological courses and minors I attach a lot of value to understand human behaviour and apply these both at work and in my personal life. I am creative and excel in both leadership roles and team-based roles by maintaining strong relationships at all levels. Furthermore, I have demonstrated strong budgeting and time- management capabilities with the ability to thrive in pressurized and rapidly evolving work environments. My collaborative efforts have built and maintained lasting relationships and driven business continuously forward.

• MSc International Business Administration
• Currently working as a container sourcing lead for Cargill Transportation and Logistics
• All-round supply chain expert with a broad range of working experience in manufacturing, wholesale, retail, and distribution environments
• International work and study experience
• Multilingual - Dutch, English, Turkish, (basic) German, (conversational) Mandarin and Korean
• Analytically minded, creative, and proficient in analyzing data (JDE One World, MS Excel, Power BI, Tableau, Minitab)
• Lean Six Sigma Black Belt theory certificate - July 2019
• Volunteering

The background photo of my profile refers to my internship in China. Besides of my internship I traveled, pioneerd, networked, and visited plenty of fairs, companies, and factories to find ideas and opportunities to bring back home. It was not only the fysical tools or products that I brought back, it enriched me and still motivates me every day to learn, understand, and excel. Reminding me that anything is possible if you have the mindset, the will, and the desire to do it and put the time in.

education.field_of_study: Negotiation and Dispute Resolution, NGOs and Global Civil Society, Media and entertainment in Korea

profile_positions.title: EMEA Business Coordinator Cargill Cocoa & Chocolate

profile_positions.description:
Cargill has over 150 years of experience in delivering agricultural-, nutritional-, financial- and industrial products and services to the world. Being a part of the Transportation & Logistics team, I work closely with the container teams around the globe and with other transport modes operating in the region.

•	50%  - Sourcing container freight, negotiating rates and managing capacity requirements for all Cargill's Enterprises and Businesses in EMEA. Also, planning and executing multiple large RFPs, providing budgetary costings, and identifying new trade lanes belong to my tasks. 
•	15% - Mapping market demand and supply and providing regular updates, forecasts and other relevant market data with the internal stakeholders. And aligning internally to capture market opportunities and deliver savings, capacity, revenue service levels required. 
•	15% - Manage stakeholders internally (Cargill Businesses, CBS Centers, peers in the container teams globally) and externally (shipping lines and other service providers). 
•	10% - Developing and deploying the group’s regional container vision and strategy and implementing improvement of strategies across businesses, aiming to 
generate value and optimize ocean freight.
•	10% - Projects and resolving process related issues arising in the course of operations.

Achievements:
Carrier contract compliance; met forecasted savings goals for EMEA; connected lanes beyond EMEA scope to achieve better sourcing results; produced regular, consistent and value adding market insights for the businesses; and supported the transition of sourcing & data contract management tasks from CBS into the region
profile_positions.title: EMEA Container Trade Lead

profile_positions.description:
Cargill Cocoa & Chocolate is a global supplier of high-quality cocoa and chocolate products

Tasks:
85% - Customer service:
• Efficient administration of customer orders and SC related administration requests
• Regular calls with customers to gather relevant market updates.
• Accurate forecasting of demand data
• Customer complaint registration and investigating incidents.
15% - Process improvement
• Advanced understanding of tools & systems
• Creating and analyzing weekly reports
• Organizing weekly meetings with representatives of different departements in the supply chain  to pursue accurate and timely order delivery
• Initiating projects to improve processes for CS

Achievements: 
All-round business experience, because of my support and contribution to all business accounts; identification and approaching of development activities within the META region to handle both short term and long term challenges; Implementation of an automatic calculation tool in order to reduce the order entry time as well as the number of errors at the order entry phase, leading to a reduction in the number of changes per order due to wrong entry. Last but not least, I kept complaints manageable and within the lead time set by management: 85% of complaints closed in 15 days, with an entry accuracy of >90%.

profile_positions.title: Deputy Store Manager

profile_positions.description:
KoalaLED is an OED and ODM manufacturer based in Shenzhen.  The firm invests in a substantial improvement on state of the art technology.
I have worked together with an ambitious team of local and international professionals to set up and develop the worldwide distribution of LED lighting.

•	Developing the marketing and sales strategy and approach for EMEA
•	Customer order follow up and after-sales support
•	Training new interns

Achievements: 
Thorough understanding of the LED market for EMEA; trends and developments within the industry; supply chain knowledge from production until end use; the optimal use of B2B portals like Alibaba and Kompass to optimize the find & contact process for our products and services; understanding of ISO and CE certifications, and standarts to improve production processes like 5S, JIT delivery; factory visits.

profile_positions.title: Online marketing specialist

volunteer_experiences.description:
The RTFF is set up with the purpose of showing the modern face of Turkey through the medium of film, enhancing cultural exchange aimed at strengthening the cultural ties between Turkey and The Netherlands by promoting Turkish cinema.

As a marketing manager and communication manager I was responsible for the online redaction, campaigns, sales activities, and data analytics to recruit visitors for the festival. 

* promotion and sales activities from the marketingplan and goals
* Analysing campaign and responsdata from online sources and generating new insights into practice
* Signalling the needs and trends of the target groups and organising sales-oriented actions based on the the vision and the marketing plan
* Developing and carrying out of the distibution plans for the purpose of media-purchases, merchandise, and posters
* Managing of the distribution team during the festival

company.name: The Hague University of Applied Sciences

volunteer_experiences.description: The management game consists of 650 students from six different departments, who work together in project teams of 12 people with the goal to set up a fictitious organization within one week. As an assistant I was responsible for various activities, which included a lot of role playing and grading of the team’s assignments. Other activities were: running the play rounds where the teams had to decide about the number of products they purchased. Here negotiating skills were in order.

Hosting the Ambassadors' Conference of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs with The Modern East Asia Research Centre (MEARC) at the University of Leiden. The gathering focused on Western perceptions and prejudices of Asia, and was centered on the inaugural address by Peter Ho, newly appointed professor of Chinese Economy and Development at Leiden and director of the Modern East Asia Research Centre. This festive occasion was complemented with keynote speeches by architect Rem Koolhaas, Mayor of The Hague, Jozias van Aartsen, and former Minister Laurens Jan Brinkhorst.

Being a part of the conference team, I supported with hosting of the conference “Asia’s Century: Prejudices, Perceptions and Perspectives.” together with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Academic China Meeting. After the event we created and released a report for the visitors of the ceremony containing information about the speeches.

The student representatives of the central representative advisory board of the Rotterdam University consisted of eight students from different institutes. I was chosen as a representative of the Rotterdam Business School (RBS) to advise the staff section of the advisory board and the executive board about different issues within different commissions.
